frameDefinitions: A Cognizer holds a particular Opinion, which may be portrayed as being about a particular Topic.
Short selling, a common financial market concept, involves an Intermediary selling Assets to the Market, having borrowed these Assets from a (generally implicit) Lender.
A Cognizer introduces a New_idea into society.
A Cognizer construes an Item as belonging to a certain Category.
A Believer has faith in a piece of Content or an Element  which fits into a religious belief system made up of many articles of faith.
This frame concerns a Cognizer's certainty about the correctness of beliefs  or expectations.
frameExamples: John <t>thinks</t> that it looks better back .
He was <t>selling</t> <t>short</t> shares from his brother's company on the NASDAQ and he made a fortune.
It is difficult to imagine how different our lives would be without Edison's <t>invention</t> of the light bulb.
You 've already <t>stereotyped</t> me as a bimbo, have n't you?
Do Muslims <t>believe</t> in the virgin birth of Jesus?
Lermontov was <t>certain</t> he would come to the party.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person whose <fen>Opinion</fen> is in question.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s way of thinking, which is not necessarily generally accepted, and which is generally dependent on the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s point of view.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has the <fen>Opinion</fen>.
The original owner and soon to be <fen>Lender</fen> of the <fen>Assets</fen>.
The financial <fen>Assets</fen> being traded.
The entity that is the borrower to the <fen>Lender</fen> and the seller and later repurchaser to the <fen>Market</fen>.
The aggregate selling place of many types of financial stocks, bond, securities, etc. The <fen>Market</fen> is also a metonym for the people who buy the <fen>Assets</fen>.
This role identifies the time at which the <fen>Intermediary</fen> engages in short selling.
This role identifies the place at which the short selling occurs.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> comes up with or conceptualizes the <fen>New_idea</fen>. It is normally expressed as an External Argument:
The <fen>New_idea</fen> is a concept not previously present in society which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> introduces.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> comes up with the <fen>New_idea</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Cognizer</fen> comes up with the <fen>New_idea</fen>.
This is the person who performs an act of categorization. Typically, this frame element is expressed as an External Argument.
This is the entity which is construed or treated by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> as being an instance of a particular <fen>Category</fen>. Typically, the <fen>Item</fen> is expressed as an Object.

This frame element expresses a general type or class of which the <fen>Item</fen> is considered an instance. Typically, it is expressed in a prepositional phrase headed by <ment>as</ment> or <ment>under</ment>.

This frame element expresses properties of the <fen>Item</fen> which is used as a basis for categorization. <fen>Criteria</fen> are the general dimensions along which <fen>Item</fen>s can potentially differ from one another and hence, fall into different <fen>Category</fen>s. For example, a paint sample can be classified <ment>by color</ment> or <ment>by finish (matte or gloss)</ment>; if they are classified by color, one can be classified <ment>as orange</ment> and another <ment>as red</ment>. The <fen>Criteria</fen> role is typically expressed as a PP headed by <ment>by</ment>, or as a complex PP of the form <ment>on the basis of...</ment>:
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate when a certain Categorization was made.
The <fen>Believer</fen> is the person whose religious beliefs are in question.
The <fen>Content</fen> is the object of the <fen>Believer</fen>'s religious conviction. <fen>Content</fen> can be expressed as a finite clause or in a in-PP Complement.
<fen>Role</fen> is a  function that an Element of the faith is believed to serve.
A predefined, fixed idea to which reference is made throughout the belief system.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person whose certainty or uncertainty is at issue.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the entity that a <fen>Cognizer</fen> has a certain/uncertain belief about.
The <fen>Content</fen> denotes the mental content that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is certain or uncertain about.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part that conveys the mental state of  the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>My</fex> take is that Johnson will not actually make it to the last round .

My take is <fex>that it is a version of the Macbeth story - what happens when people
become violent but cannot quite handle it</fex>.
<fex>Kim Sung</fex> invented cinnamon cheez fries in 1988.
The strong gravitic shield was discovered <fex>in 2162</fex>.
Was the light bulb invented <fex>in Austria</fex>?
<fex>Kim</fex> categorized the books under fiction. <fex>Kim</fex> categorized them on the basis of genre.
The students were categorized <fex>on the basis of their test scores</fex>.
<fex>20 years ago</fex> people would consider this as nothing unusual
A Christian believes <fex>that Jesus of Nazareth was a prophet</fex>.
If a person believes in Jesus <fex>as his Saviour</fex>, he can he baptized.
<fex>Marcel</fex> was sure that she had seen Eldridge on the balcony.
She talked of quests , of finding this absurd religious character , but he was unsure <fex>of her conviction</fex>.
I am sure <fex>that we'll arrive on time</fex>.
She caught sight of her mother's dubious <fex>expression</fex>.
